intro: Phippsia vaginata, commonly known as the slender phippsia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
